title: Workshop on Semi-Supervised Learning-Based AI Modeling for Dental CBCT Image Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basics of medical image processing, experience with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch/TensorFlow), and fundamental knowledge of CBCT image interpretation
context.additional_context: Training for in-service dental imaging professionals aimed at strengthening the capacity to develop AI models applicable in clinical settings

learning_goals: Designing a deep learning model for accurate segmentation of teeth, bone, and lesion regions in 3D CBCT images

Learners compare three semi-supervised learning techniques (e.g., self-learning, label propagation) within a week, and propose optimization strategies (e.g., data augmentation, transfer learning) achieving over 80% model accuracy with fewer than 100 labeled data points.
Implementing a knowledge-based loss function incorporating oral anatomical knowledge

Learners validate three AI models (reinforcement learning, computer vision, NLP) in a VR simulation environment (Unity ML-Agents) at least three times within a week, and propose improvements achieving an average 15% accuracy enhancement.

resources: Oral anatomical map (plaque lesion location map)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
